comments.author: Victoria

top_comment.text:
I might get a puppy which is 8 months old but i have school so he would be 
alone for 6 hours... what should i do?﻿
top_comment.author: Alava Pena

comments.text:
+Faris Jaclyn thank you, I am a bit confused though because at the dog 
shelter they said it was fine if he had a lot of toys...
comments.author: Alava Pena

comments.text:
Not get a puppy until you have more time or wait until you are off for the 
summer break to potty train your puppy. The puppy will be way too bored for 
six hours alone per day. It will not be good for a young dog for many 
reasons. Highly suggest waiting until you are able to stay home with the 
dog longer. Or get an older dog.
comments.author: Faris Jaclyn

top_comment.text:
ummm what if people have a full time job and they can't walk their dog once 
every hour???﻿
top_comment.author: ewilddog

comments.text:
In the episode I mention that you start out with every hour on the hour and 
then you decrease the amounts depending on how well your dog is doing. It 
would help you to take your dog to a puppy class. This will socialize the 
dog to other dogs and will give you more personalized information to help 
your needs. It's very important to take puppy classes to get your dog used 
to other dogs their age.
comments.author: Faris Jaclyn

comments.text:
guess that make sense well my wife isn't working atm guess she can do this 
but does it really has to be once every hour? ain't that a bit 2 frequent? 
and plus we living in a apartment and we got a toy poodle hope that helps u 
answering my questions
comments.author: ewilddog

comments.text:
I get this question a lot. The best time to potty train a puppy or get a 
new dog in general is when you have time off from work. Would you have a 
newborn baby and still work full time? No. People obviously have raised a 
puppy and crated it all day but in my opinion it's not fair for the dog. I 
would suggest getting a dog walker, or someone to help you out. I'm not 
trying to be mean in any way.
comments.author: Faris Jaclyn

captions.text:
Hello My name is Faris and this is my puppy
training series. You will probably find a

playlist on the side or you'll have to go
to my Youtube channel and there will be a

playlist.These techniques are for puppies
but can be applied to adult dogs.

Create a 'Potty Schedule Log'.
Baby dogs just like baby humans do well when

on a schedule. Even in adulthood dogs and
humans function better with a routine set

into place. For example my dog Bueller is
taken on a walk everyday at about the same

time. Right when we wake up I take Bueller
outside and when you have a puppy, PUPPY gets

to go to the 
bathroom first not you! We have two potty
breaks during the day and one potty break
right before bed.

Example of Bueller's Potty Schedule:
8AM - Wake up Pee/Poop

2PM - Pee/Maybe Poop
6PM - Pee/Maybe Poop
9PM - Pee/Poop

WARNING THIS IS AN ADULT DOG SCHEDULE!! THIS
IS NOT OKAY FOR PUPPY!!!

Set your dog up to succeed, don't right away
push their limits and think potty training

is obtainable so easily and you'll be on a
schedule just like this. With your Potty Schedule

Log write everything and anything that happens
done on your log. Not only should you plan

your potty breaks, but you should plan your
meals at the same time everyday. After puppy

eats they will need to relieve themselves.
Sometimes this happens within minutes of finishing
the meal!!! Remember that!

Most accidents happen because of a miscommunication.
Please remember that it may be your fault

and not the puppies, especially because you
are the one that has to make this successful
in the first place.

No matter if it's an accident or not write
down everything. You may be able to figure

out what triggered the incident by looking
at what happened before. Know what triggers
your dog to relieve themselves.

Here are some examples:
1. Drinking water

2. Playing vigorously
3. Eating a meal

4. Waking up
5. Excitement

This may sound like a lot of work but remember
you have a baby now! Don't think of it as

a 'puppy' it's a dog baby you have a baby
of another species. Congratulations! And by

the way your dog's bladder isn't fully developed
until a year of age so don't expect your dog

to be completely 100% potty trained before
the first year. There will be accidents and
it will be a working progress.

So here's how to start your Potty Schedule
Log, every hour on the hour take your pup

out for a bathroom break. Take them to the
same spot every time and say go potty. Remember

to praise right when they've finished. After
a while you can decrease the amount of times

you take the dog out. Now this is where it
becomes more of a case by case situation and

accidents are going to happen. Understand
what your dog can handle.

For more information I have two previous episodes
on Potty Training you can watch. Not only

would I recommend watching this video, the
two potty training 
episodes but I would also watch 
my crate training vs long term confinement
space episode.
